07078.description: New Eyes for the Needy will have a three week summer EyeVolunteer Program for High School Students, July 10-26, on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday mornings from 9:30am-12:30pm. Students will learn about a non-profit organization while performing community service. Tasks will include: learning to identify and sort donated glasses by type of prescription, reading prescriptions using a lensometer, packing glasses for shipment overseas, and performing miscellaneous projects such as administration, facility maintenance, and gardening. Hours will be recorded and supplied to the students at the conclusion of the program. Students should be aged 14-18 and must be available for all sessions, July 10-26. Only 20 students will be accepted and a $20 fee is requested to cover the cost of a t-shirt and snacks/water. To apply, students should send an email to Sally Golding, Volunteer Manager, at sgolding@new-eyes.org, explaining why they are interested in the program. New Eyes is located at 549 Millburn Ave., Short Hills, NJ. New Eyes provides vouchers for new prescription glasses to the needy in the U.S. and redistributes collected eyeglasses to the poor in developing countries through aid organizations and small medical missions.
07078.title: July High School EyeVolunteer Program

08861.description: On Thursday, August 16th we host a health fair for our community including Free screenings, giveaways, and entertainment. We are requesting volunteers to assist with the set-up and breakdown of this event. Volunteers will also engage with the community/participants in various ways: sign them up to receive alerts/notifications from us help with the various raffles taking place this day take pictures of the health fair help set up proclamation ceremony w/ the Mayor and possible other selected officials hand out flyers/information
08861.title: National Health Center Week 2018

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

11793.description: Hi volunteers! Here are the details for this exciting opportunity to work with Musicians Against Gun Violence at our table at the Vans Warped Tour at Jones Beach Amphitheatre on Saturday July 28th. Event volunteers will be given a pass to the festival in exchange for their work engaging the lines into the venue and at our table in the Warped tent. Responsibilities will include set up and breakdown, clearly conveying our mission to attendees, discussing the raffle and petition drive with interested parties, directing concertgoers to take online actions, collecting petition signatures, conducting the giveaway and occasionally mitigating conflict with hardline 2A'ers where necessary. To be considered for this gig, you must be passionate and knowledgeable about common sense gun control legislation as well as comfortable and adept at de-escalating tense exchanges with folks opposed to our mission (as there WILL be some). Comfort with using a bullhorn is a plus! Transportation and overnight accommodation are not provided. You will have the opportunity to catch some acts as the Warped tent breaks down at 6pm and the show goes for hours beyond that. This opportunity requires one volunteer to act as lead and one as assistant. Lead must be available for an online training session on Monday July 23rd, or have access to archived video of the session and view it before the event date. Volunteers must also have a smartphone for communication with Warped Tour point person and each other. Please indicate in your response whether you are interested in the \"lead\" or \"assistant\" position. Follow up directly with an email to our director Serena Fill at admin@musiciansagainstgunviolence.com. Cheers and thanks for reading!
11793.title: Volunteer on 7/28 at Warped Tour with Musicians Against Gun Violence!

11793.description: Do you want to volunteer at the Vans Warped Tour in your city? Are you passionate about youth empowerment and exercising your right to vote? Then sign up to volunteer with I’m Down To Vote at your local date of the final cross-country Vans Warped Tour! We are looking for 2 volunteers per date to help us encourage young people 13+ to commit to voting when they turn 18! Please note we are strictly non-partisan and do not represent any political parties. We have one agenda: To encourage everyone eligible to vote! Additionally, you will be talking with Warped Tour attendees and also be helping with day-of promotion of the tent. If interested, please fill out this form! http://imdowntovote.org/volunteer-with-us/
11793.title: Vans Warped Tour I'm Down To Vote Volunteer - Wantagh, NY

11793.description: Volunteers are needed to help with this wonderful event to find a cure for brain tumors! The Long Island Brain Tumor Walk will be held at Jones Beach, Field 5 on Saturday, September 15, 2018. We have volunteer opportunities to assist with set up on Friday, September 14th during the day and a large number of opportunities available on walk day ranging from registration and incentive distribution to cheerleading for our walkers, to solicitation of donated goods to help make the event go smoothly for all. We are looking for coffee, water, snack and fresh fruit donations If you're unavailable that day but want to help distribute marketing materials or help with sponsorship, please reach out today! To see a full list of volunteer options visit: http://events.braintumor.org/events/long-island-brain-tumor-walk/volunteer-roles/. Please note that registration/banking volunteers are required to take a training over the phone via a zoom meeting, prior to the walk. We are seeking new members to join our walk planning committee for those who want to get involved year-round to help plan and execute the walk. All funds raised through our events allow the National Brain Tumor Society to advance research and public policy to improve the availability of new and better treatments, and fuel the discovery of a cure for brain tumors. Volunteers are the bedrock our existence and this special event would not be possible without you. Thank you for your time and generosity.
11793.title: Long Island Brain Tumor Walk

07470.description: At this hour-long, no commitment volunteer information session, you will learn about the Passaic County Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) volunteer program and how you can make a difference in the lives of Passaic County children in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained, dedicated adults who look out for a child's best interests while helping him or her move toward a safe and permanent home. CASAs have been best described as the \"eyes and ears\" of the Family Court. From helping siblings find permanent homes together to helping a child access needed services to uncovering information that helps reunite a loving family, CASA volunteers make an incredible difference to the lives of abused and neglected children. Currently, there are more than 300 children who are waiting for an advocate just like you. Come join us and learn more! Please RSVP here: http://www.passaiccountycasa.org/orientation/. For more information, call Jessica at 973-832-4002, ext. 201 or e-mail Jessica@passaiccountycasa.org.
07470.title: Every child has a chance - it's you.
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. The Editor is responsible for reviewing articles submitted by The Borgen Project’s national team of writers. Editors will also perform edits for articles appearing on BORGEN Magazine and The Borgen Project Blog. Our volunteer position is a part-time, work from home role. You can set your own schedule and specify how many hours per week you wish to work. - Edit and format articles submitted by national writers. - Work with writers to improve their articles. Qualifications: Must have great editing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required. To apply: Please email a copy of your resume and two writing samples to hr@borgenproject.org
07470.title: Volunteer Editor- New Jersey

11797.description: Are you passionate in the fight to save lives and help create a world without cancer? Do you want to be a part of the official kickoff to breast cancer awareness season in Long Island? Event: The Corporate Breakfast is a high-energy, inspirational event where Team Leaders come to celebrate breast cancer survivors, learn about our research achievements, and discover the local programs and services we offer. Last year, the Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Corporate Kickoff Breakfast welcomed 1,000 guests, including 200 survivors. Breakfast attendees are team leaders from a variety of different industries, including Fortune 500 companies, large corporations, small local businesses, health systems, as well as members of the community. Description: The Making Strides of Long Island is seeking 10 volunteers to support our staff during the kickoff. Duties include but not limited to: *Final decorating details *Check-in of guests *Merchandise sales *Distribution of Team Leader gift *Collection of registration forms *Assistance with online registration (training provided) *Packing up and loading event materials *Photography of event Expectations: *Attire: Business Appropriate (not casual or business casual) *Arrive at venue at 6:30 AM for final instructions *Plan to stay until all materials packed and loaded into transport cars *Typically a modest spread of breakfast items are provided for staff & volunteers on a rotating basis, however please plan accordingly and come with energy to complete the morning For more information about this volunteer opportunity, please email Christine.haskell@cancer.org Please email your name ( First & Last), address, along with your phone number and email address. ------------------------------------------------------------------ The American Cancer Society's Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. The Making Strides of Long Island bring together more than 80.000 local participants and have raised more than $2,5 Million annually.
11797.title: Corporate Kickoff Volunteer

08901.description: Join us for informal information session! We will discuss what how a CASA champions abused and neglected children in foster care. Samantha Schamach, Outreach Coordinator: One of my favorite parts of running these sessions is sitting around the table wondering who will walk through the door this week. I have meet some of the most unique, passionate and inspiring people. Not to mention the out of the box thinkers, legal whiz's, rule & procedures gurus and fierce parents and grandparents looking for their next adventure. And if you've been to one of my sessions than you know that by the end of the informal presentation we are all on a first name basis with one another, hopefully exchanging social media info or cell numbers. As we walk back out that door we are ready to greet Saturday morning with a little more bounce in our step. So who will we be meeting this weekend? Won't you join us? Cain't Wait! :)
08901.title: Become a Child Advocate:   INFORMATION SESSION

08901.description: Are you warm, friendly, and energetic? Do you love collaboration and working with children? Then The Salvation Army New Brunswick Corps wants you! We are looking for enthusiastic, positive, creative and nurturing volunteer Summer Day Camp Leaders to join us. Camp runs for six weeks during July-August. Volunteers should expect to commit 2hr/session Position Responsibilities: Our Day Camp Leaders get to wear many hats during camp: High level of interaction with kids, parents, staff and the community Create a camp atmosphere for kids and staff by leading skits, songs, and wearing costumes Help plan and implement daily program activities and special events. Set a good example for kids and staff in the overall presentation of program and self, including punctuality, cleanliness, sportsmanship and respectful behavior toward kids, parents, staff, members, and community Responsible for up to 10 Participate in weekly field trips off-site, local park trips, and weekly swim activities Applicants with Early Childhood Education (ECE) units are encouraged to apply .
08901.title: Summer Day Camp Activities Helper- New Brunswick
08901.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

08901.description: Help combat community hunger at the 5 Loaves Pantry. Volunteers help unload and sort food, organize pantry items, and assist clients with shopping.
08901.title: Marketplace in New Brunswick

08902.description: Dear Residents of South Brunswick Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
08902.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students
